column4: is it possible to make dhcpclient run on the background at boot? (i don't won't to wait 60 sec at Configuring Network Interfaces when there's nothing to configure)
you can always press ctrl c to have it skip it but as bob2 said if your not going to use it disable it :)
sometime i need it so i don't want to disable.
ctrl c works, but after that totem don't work (i don't understand why such thing happen)
